intro: Pseudabutilon spicatum, commonly known as the spicatum abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Pseudabutilon spicatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
